content:
• Wednesday, July 20, 2011
  • INTC

    Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) is using its Q2 earnings CC to lower its 2011 PC unit growth forecast to...

    Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) is using its Q2 earnings CC to lower its 2011 PC unit growth forecast to 8-10% from a prior 15%; many analysts expected such a drop. The company says corporate PC demand is "healthy," but consumer demand is "soft." Strong growth is seen in emerging markets, and pricing is expected to be "relatively flat." Shares -1.8% AH. (Q2 results) (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • AZN

    AstraZeneca (NYSE:AZN) receives FDA approval for its BRILINTA tablets to reduce the rate of...

    AstraZeneca (NYSE:AZN) receives FDA approval for its BRILINTA tablets to reduce the rate of heart attack in adult patients with acute coronary syndrome. Shares +1.62% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM
  • STX

    StreetInsider reports Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) is guiding for adjusted FQ1 2012 EPS of $0.29-$0.33...

    StreetInsider reports Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) is guiding for adjusted FQ1 2012 EPS of $0.29-$0.33 during its CC, well below a consensus of $0.43. Revenues are expected to be $2.9B, slightly above the $2.87B consensus. Shares now -11.6% AH. (FQ4 results) (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM
  • INTC

    Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) shares give up gains, now -1.8% AH, despite the large beat on earnings. Herb...

    Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) shares give up gains, now -1.8% AH, despite the large beat on earnings. Herb Greenberg points out that revenue growth continues to fall, +22% this quarter vs. +32% one year ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM | 7 Comments
  • FFIV

    F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV) is now down 7.6% AH following its FQ3 release, adding to the 6.1% drop...

    F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV) is now down 7.6% AH following its FQ3 release, adding to the 6.1% drop it registered today following Riverbed's (NASDAQ:RVBD) FQ2 results. The company set FQ4 revenue and EPS guidance of $307M-$312M and $0.97-$0.99, in line with a consensus of $309.7M and $0.98. The market was apparently looking for more. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM
  • QCOM

    More on Qualcommn's (NASDAQ:QCOM) FQ3 results: The company is expecting 8-13% Y/Y growth in FQ4...

    More on Qualcommn's (NASDAQ:QCOM) FQ3 results: The company is expecting 8-13% Y/Y growth in FQ4 for baseband chip (MSM) shipments, down from 17% in FQ3. However, the company is lifting its estimated FY11 average selling price for CDMA devices (on which it collects royalties) to $204-$210, up from $199-$209. Shares -2.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • INTC

    Intel (NASDAQ:INTC): Q2 EPS of $0.59 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $13.1B (+22% Y/Y) beats by...

    Intel (NASDAQ:INTC): Q2 EPS of $0.59 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $13.1B (+22% Y/Y) beats by $280M. Shares +0.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • CA

    CA Inc. (NASDAQ:CA): FQ1 EPS of $0.55 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $1.16B (+9% Y/Y). (PR)

    CA Inc. (NASDAQ:CA): FQ1 EPS of $0.55 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $1.16B (+9% Y/Y). (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • FFIV

    F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV): FQ3 EPS of $0.97 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $290.7M (+26% Y/Y) in...

    F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV): FQ3 EPS of $0.97 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $290.7M (+26% Y/Y) in line. Shares -6.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • STX

    Seagate Technology (NASDAQ:STX): FQ4 EPS of $0.28 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $2.9B (+8% Y/Y). (PR)

    Seagate Technology (NASDAQ:STX): FQ4 EPS of $0.28 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $2.9B (+8% Y/Y). (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • QCOM

    Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) reports FQ3 non-GAAP EPS $0.73, beats by $0.02. Revenue of $3.62B (+34%...

    Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) reports FQ3 non-GAAP EPS $0.73, beats by $0.02. Revenue of $3.62B (+34% Y/Y) beats by $0.03B. Company raises FY11 non-GAAP EPS guidance to a range of $3.15-$3.20, up from $3.05-$3.13. Raises FY11 revenue guidance to a range of $14.7B-$15B, up from $14.1B-$14.7B. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • STJ

    St. Jude (STJ +2.1%) shares turn around after early losses, as analysts decide Q2 performance...

    St. Jude (STJ +2.1%) shares turn around after early losses, as analysts decide Q2 performance was solid and weakness in the cardiac device market could've been worse. Its modest full-year guidance cut "removes an investor overhang," Collins Stewart says, since expectations had already dipped months ago when it was clear the cardiac market was stumbling.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • XUE

    Xueda Education (XUE +5.4%) holds on to gains following Deutsche's buy initiation earlier today....

    Xueda Education (XUE +5.4%) holds on to gains following Deutsche's buy initiation earlier today. Deutsche says the personalized tutoring space in China is expected to grow significantly through 2014, and Xueda, with "unrivaled geographical coverage," is well positioned to gain.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO -7.6%) is now the S&P's leading loser on the day, after reporting...

    Yahoo (YHOO -7.6%) is now the S&P's leading loser on the day, after reporting lower-than-expected Q2 revenue, mostly from its core display advertising business, and forecasting a weaker Q3. CEO Carol Bartz blames the shortfall on disruption from sales force changes, but there's no way to spin it: It's a "significant disappointment."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM
  • MANH

    Manhattan Associates (MANH +8.59%) holds on to gains after beating Q2 estimates and boosting its...

    Manhattan Associates (MANH +8.59%) holds on to gains after beating Q2 estimates and boosting its 2011 EPS forecast to the top-end of guidance. EPS rose by more than 50% Y/Y, as the company posted healthy gains in revenue across virtually all business units.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • CASC

    Oncothyreon (ONTY +16%) is higher today on a rumor that Phase III results of its cancer...

    Oncothyreon (ONTY +16%) is higher today on a rumor that Phase III results of its cancer treatment drug Stimuvax are meeting endpoints. The stock has been heavily shorted recently - short interest now averages 2+ days to cover - adding to the stock's volatility.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • Z

    Zillow (NASDAQ:Z) shares are now changing hands around $39 - well below their opening level of...

    Zillow (NASDAQ:Z) shares are now changing hands around $39 - well below their opening level of $60, but still up nearly 95% from their offering price of $20. Meanwhile, headphone maker Skullcandy (NASDAQ:SKUL) is recording a far more modest 1.5% gain from its $20 IPO price.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • SPR

    Spirit AeroSystems (NYSE:SPR) is up 5.4% on mixed news - while the company says it will take a...

    Spirit AeroSystems (NYSE:SPR) is up 5.4% on mixed news - while the company says it will take a $0.26/share charge related to its Gulfstream G250 wing assembly program, the midpoint of its Q2 EPS guidance excluding the charge is $0.46, above the $0.45 consensus. In addition, BB&T Capital has initiated coverage with a Buy rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • RVBD

    Weakness in Riverbed Technology (RVBD -23.4%) weighs on networking peer Aruba Networks (ARUN...

    Weakness in Riverbed Technology (RVBD -23.4%) weighs on networking peer Aruba Networks (ARUN -10.2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • TSLA

    Tesla Motors (TSLA +4.5%) scores a much bigger deal than expected after a SEC filing shows the...

    Tesla Motors (TSLA +4.5%) scores a much bigger deal than expected after a SEC filing shows the agreement to supply an electric powertrain for Toyota's (TM +0.1%) RAV-4s between 2012 and 2014 is worth approximately $100M.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • MUR

    Shares of Murphy Oil (MUR +5.3%) jump after DealReporter says the operator of gasoline filling...

    Shares of Murphy Oil (MUR +5.3%) jump after DealReporter says the operator of gasoline filling stations might be in merger talks with Canada’s Husky Energy (OTCPK:HUSKF -0.7%).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • RVBD

    Several analysts are rushing to Riverbed's (RVBD -23.5%) defense. FBR Capital calls the...

    Several analysts are rushing to Riverbed's (RVBD -23.5%) defense. FBR Capital calls the company's weak Q2 an "air pocket quarter;" and Canaccord considers the European organizational issues it sees as behind the shortfall to be fixable. However, RBC thinks the company's sales execution problems could take several quarters to fix. (PR) (CC transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • LUFK

    SunTrust upgrades Lufkin Industries (LUFK -6.1%) to Buy from Neutral, helping shares make a...

    SunTrust upgrades Lufkin Industries (LUFK -6.1%) to Buy from Neutral, helping shares make a partial recovery from their early-day hammering after the firm's Q2 earnings miss.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM
  • FTNT

    More on Fortinet (FTNT -22.8%): Q2 EPS more than doubled on better-than-expected revenue....

    More on Fortinet (FTNT -22.8%): Q2 EPS more than doubled on better-than-expected revenue. However, Wedbush notes a deceleration in European revenue growth, which led to billings coming in-line with guidance instead of beating expectations as they had for several quarters.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • HBI

    Shares of Hanesbrands (HBI -8.2%) fall after the company confirmed its full-year 2011 diluted...

    Shares of Hanesbrands (HBI -8.2%) fall after the company confirmed its full-year 2011 diluted EPS guidance of $2.70-$2.90, and says it sees pressure on margins from cotton prices and potential wage hikes in Central America, China and Vietnam. A planned price increase to dampen those costs may reduce sales, analysts say.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM
  • IDCC

    InterDigital (IDCC +14.5%) is part of a growing class of companies dubbed "patent trolls," which...

    InterDigital (IDCC +14.5%) is part of a growing class of companies dubbed "patent trolls," which don’t make products, but make money from licensing patented technology and fighting in court to enforce its patents. Its decision to explore a sale may have been sparked by Google's (GOOG -1.1%) interest after losing out on Nortel's $4.5B patent sale; the two companies reportedly are talking.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • NXST

    Nexstar Broadcasting (NXST +26.5%) is putting itself up for sale that could fetch more than $1B...

    Nexstar Broadcasting (NXST +26.5%) is putting itself up for sale that could fetch more than $1B and has hired a financial adviser to engage potential buyers, WSJ reports. Nexstar operates or provides sales and related services to 65 TV stations, many of which are affiliates of large networks like NBC and CBS.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • KCG

    Shares of Knight Capital Group (KCG +7.6%) soar after higher Q2 revenue helps the firm overcome...

    Shares of Knight Capital Group (KCG +7.6%) soar after higher Q2 revenue helps the firm overcome its EPS miss. Raymond James analyst Patrick O'Shaughnessy notes the strong revenue was driven by substantial growth in the firm's FICC business segment that focuses on clearing trades.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • TEL

    More on TE Connectivity (TEL +4.5%): FQ3 profits rose +7.6% as the top line got a boost from...

    More on TE Connectivity (TEL +4.5%): FQ3 profits rose +7.6% as the top line got a boost from acquisitions and sales strength in its communications and industrial-solutions units, which helped to offset higher material costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • MEG

    Media General (MEG -11.7%) gets hit after reporting a wider Q2 loss on diminished revenue from...

    Media General (MEG -11.7%) gets hit after reporting a wider Q2 loss on diminished revenue from advertising. Print ad revenue - a barometer of economic conditions - dropped nearly 10% in what CEO Marshall Morton characterizes as "a faltering economy."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • RVBD

    A number of networking equipment companies are moving lower in the wake of Riverbed's (RVBD...

    A number of networking equipment companies are moving lower in the wake of Riverbed's (RVBD -23.5%) disappointing Q2 results. FFIV -5.6%. APKT -7.7%. ALLT -4.6%. PLCM -3.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • URI

    Shares of United Rentals (URI +6.4%) soar a day after missing EPS estimates. Improved margins...

    Shares of United Rentals (URI +6.4%) soar a day after missing EPS estimates. Improved margins and higher rental revenue are buoying the firm's shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • BRCD

    Brocade (BRCD -4%) is unsurprisingly trading down following Dell's (DELL-OLD) Force10 buy, with...

    Brocade (BRCD -4%) is unsurprisingly trading down following Dell's (DELL-OLD) Force10 buy, with Avian Securities downgrading the firm to Neutral, and Bloomberg reporting Dell passed on Brocade to acquire Force10. Netgear (NTGR -5.5%), which sells enterprise switches that compete with part of Force10's lineup, is also moving lower.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • HOGS

    Zhongpin (HOGS -8.8%) continues to decline after the company held a conference call yesterday to...

    Zhongpin (HOGS -8.8%) continues to decline after the company held a conference call yesterday to address recent stock price volatility. The shares are down over 27% since China announced last week it was taking steps to bring down pork prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • BBND

    Cable infrastructure equipment provider BigBand Networks (NASDAQ:BBND) pops 12.1% after...

    Cable infrastructure equipment provider BigBand Networks (NASDAQ:BBND) pops 12.1% after announcing AT&T (NYSE:T) will be deploying BigBand's local TV ad solution for its U-verse service. Prior to today's move, BigBand, which has been bleeding cash for many quarters, had a market cap very close to its net cash position of $131M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • PJC

    Shares of Piper Jaffray (PJC +14.4%) pop after the firm beat estimates. Q2 earnings were...

    Shares of Piper Jaffray (PJC +14.4%) pop after the firm beat estimates. Q2 earnings were $10.7M (+45% Y/Y), and EPS increased to $0.55/share (+53% Y/Y) vs. consensus estimates of $0.49/share. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • LUFK

    Lufkin Industries (LUFK -8.8%) gets hit after reporting a Q2 bottom-line miss due to higher wage...

    Lufkin Industries (LUFK -8.8%) gets hit after reporting a Q2 bottom-line miss due to higher wage and capital costs. The company also reduces guidance for Q3, saying that similar challenges are likely to continue.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • Z

    Zillow (NASDAQ:Z) posts its first post-IPO trades, now at $43.91 vs. the $20 offering price,...

    Zillow (NASDAQ:Z) posts its first post-IPO trades, now at $43.91 vs. the $20 offering price, +120%. The shares initially traded as high as $60.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM | 2 Comments
  • SNOFF

    Sino-Forest (OTC:SNOFF) shares pop 12.5% after Richard Chandler, who runs a Singapore investment...

    Sino-Forest (OTC:SNOFF) shares pop 12.5% after Richard Chandler, who runs a Singapore investment firm, announced he owns 11% of its outstanding stock. Still, shares at ~$5 are well off levels of $20-plus in May, before financial allegations about the company began to circulate.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • CHL

    China Mobile (CHL +3.1%) gains on speculation it may offer Apple's (AAPL +2.4%) iPhone as early...

    China Mobile (CHL +3.1%) gains on speculation it may offer Apple's (AAPL +2.4%) iPhone as early as September in a market that already saw a large monthly gain in mobile subscribers for June. Total subscriber tally: China Mobile 617M, China Unicom (CHU -1.1%) 182M, China Telecom (CHA -0.5%) 108M.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • CTRN

    Urban apparel retailer Citi Trends (CTRN -16%) takes a hit after forecasting a...

    Urban apparel retailer Citi Trends (CTRN -16%) takes a hit after forecasting a wider-than-expected loss for Q2, and plans fewer store openings this year due to weak sales. The company now expects to post a loss of $0.60 to $0.70 per share, greater than the $0.12 loss estimated by Wall Street.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • PFE

    More on the Pfizer (NYSE:PFE)/Icagen (NASDAQ:ICGN) deal: The 23% drop in ICGN should be put into...

    More on the Pfizer (NYSE:PFE)/Icagen (NASDAQ:ICGN) deal: The 23% drop in ICGN should be put into context by considering the stock has soared over 220% since late June, when news of the merger talks began.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • DVAX

    Dynavax (DVAX -28%) plunges after saying late-stage data from a study of its hepatitis B vaccine...

    Dynavax (DVAX -28%) plunges after saying late-stage data from a study of its hepatitis B vaccine Heplisav failed to meet its primary endpoint. The problem is a solvable one, but adds uncertainty to the trials and could lead to delays in the product's release.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM | 1 Comment
  • WINN

    Shares of Winn-Dixie (WINN +12.5%) pop after Jefferies upgrades the firm to a Buy, and raises...

    Shares of Winn-Dixie (WINN +12.5%) pop after Jefferies upgrades the firm to a Buy, and raises the price target for shares to $10.50 from $8.50. The firm's take on WINN is sales may be getting a bigger lift than expected after cycling out the effects of the Gulf oil spill.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM | 1 Comment
  • AAL

    Shares of American Airlines (AMR +1.6%) gain after reporting earnings, and announcing its intent...

    Shares of American Airlines (AMR +1.6%) gain after reporting earnings, and announcing its intent to spinoff American Eagle to shareholders. Other airline stocks can't keep up, and are mired in red: DAL -1.8%, LUV -0.1%, JBLU -0.8%, UAL -1.7%, LCC -1.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • IDCC

    InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC) is up another 13.9% today, adding to yesterday's 28.3% gain following...

    InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC) is up another 13.9% today, adding to yesterday's 28.3% gain following an announcement that it would explore strategic alternatives, including a possible sale. With the company's enterprise value now approaching $2.3B, the market clearly thinks InterDigital's huge 3G/4G patent portfolio will fetch a high price.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • AMZN

    Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) and CBS ink a deal to allow Amazon Prime customers - at no extra charge -...

    Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) and CBS ink a deal to allow Amazon Prime customers - at no extra charge - to stream TV shows from the broadcaster's content library. Additionally, movies and TV shows from CBS will be available for all Amazon customers to purchase or rent. CBS +2.7%. NFLX -2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • PFE

    Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) is acquiring Icagen (NASDAQ:ICGN), a developer of pain relief drugs, for...

    Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) is acquiring Icagen (NASDAQ:ICGN), a developer of pain relief drugs, for $6/share. After accounting for Pfizer's current 11% stake in the company, the transaction will cost approximately $49.8M. Icagen, which closed yesterday at $7.75, is down 23.2% on the news. One legal firm is already announcing an investigation into the deal.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM
  • KODK

    Another reason for Kodak's (EK 5.2%) bounce is that it's exploring options for its 1,100 U.S....

    Another reason for Kodak's (EK 5.2%) bounce is that it's exploring options for its 1,100 U.S. patents related to digital imaging. Kodak expects 2011 IP revenues of $250M-$350M, although this income is unpredictable as it often comes in one-time payments. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:32 AM
  • AAPL

    Estimates and price targets are predictably rising following Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) FQ3 results....

    Estimates and price targets are predictably rising following Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) FQ3 results. Ticonderoga is raising its PT to $666, arguing the iPhone and iPad's growth is still in its early stages; UBS thinks gross margin guidance could be conservative; and Piper Jaffray and Canaccord expect massive emerging markets growth. AAPL +5.3% premarket. (PR) (CC transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM | 1 Comment
  • ETFC

    Disappointed with the company's financial performance, Citadel calls on E-Trade (NASDAQ:ETFC) to...

    Disappointed with the company's financial performance, Citadel calls on E-Trade (NASDAQ:ETFC) to hold a special shareholder meeting to discuss the removal of two board directors and a possible sale. The hedge-fund operator's suffered a turbulent relationship with the online broker since injecting $2.7B to help it avoid bankruptcy three years ago. Shares +12% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • AAPL

    Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) earnings prowess spills over to its suppliers, as Cirrus Logic...

    Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) earnings prowess spills over to its suppliers, as Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS), supplier of chips used in Apple devices such as the iPod and iPad, +8.1% premarket. Fellow Apple suppliers also higher: ARMH +2.5%, BRCM +1.8%, OVTI +4.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • ISRG

    Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG) posts a solid Q2 yesterday, with a 32% jump in profits as sales...

    Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG) posts a solid Q2 yesterday, with a 32% jump in profits as sales of its Da Vinci robotic surgery system continue to grow. Goldman upgrades the stock to Neutral, and JPMorgan, Morgan Stanley and Morgan Keegan all raise price targets. Shares +4.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:45 AM
  • MON

    Goldman Sachs adds Monsanto (NYSE:MON) to its Conviction Buy list, along with a $96 price...

    Goldman Sachs adds Monsanto (NYSE:MON) to its Conviction Buy list, along with a $96 price target. Shares +2% premarket to $75.36.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM
  • FTNT

    Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT) plunges after yesterday's earnings miss, but gets a little support from...

    Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT) plunges after yesterday's earnings miss, but gets a little support from Stifel with an upgrade to Buy from Hold on valuation. Shares -16.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM
  • KODK

    Kodak (EK) continues its run from yesterday, bouncing to +6.1% premarket after the ITC ended its...

    Kodak (EK) continues its run from yesterday, bouncing to +6.1% premarket after the ITC ended its investigation into whether Kodak violated Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) patents by declining to review an earlier decision on the case.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:30 AM | 2 Comments
  • CLX

    Marketwatch reports Carl Icahn is raising his bid for Clorox (NYSE:CLX) to $80/share, from a...

    Marketwatch reports Carl Icahn is raising his bid for Clorox (NYSE:CLX) to $80/share, from a prior level of $76.50. CLX +4.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM
  • APH

    More on Amphenol (NYSE:APH) earnings: Guidance- Q3 EPS $0.77-0.79, Revenue $1-1.02B; FY'11 EPS...

    More on Amphenol (NYSE:APH) earnings: Guidance- Q3 EPS $0.77-0.79, Revenue $1-1.02B; FY'11 EPS of $3.13-3.17, Revenue $3.98-4B. Shares +2.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 AM
  • APH

    Amphenol (NYSE:APH): Q2 EPS of $0.79 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $1.02B (+15% Y/Y). Shares +2.7%...

    Amphenol (NYSE:APH): Q2 EPS of $0.79 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $1.02B (+15% Y/Y). Shares +2.7% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 AM
  • ALTH

    Allos Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ALTH) merges with AMAG Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AMAG) in a $686M...

    Allos Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ALTH) merges with AMAG Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AMAG) in a $686M all-stock deal. The combined firm expects to realize annual cost savings synergies of between $55 million and $60 million, primarily in the first fiscal year after closing. Shares of ALTH +9.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM
  • DELL

    More on EMC's Q2 results: Q2 revenues beat consensus by $120M; company raises 2011 rev. guidance...

    More on EMC's Q2 results: Q2 revenues beat consensus by $120M; company raises 2011 rev. guidance by $200M to $19.8B; raises 2011 non-GAAP EPS guidance by $0.02 to $1.48; high-end Symmetrix storage revs. up 15% Y/Y, down from 25% in Q1; "mid-tier" storage revs up 27% Y/Y, up from 20% in Q1. Shares +2.6% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:54 AM
  • ABT

    Abbott Laboratories (NYSE:ABT): Q2 EPS of $1.12 in-line. Revenue of $9.62B (+9% Y/Y). Raises...

    Abbott Laboratories (NYSE:ABT): Q2 EPS of $1.12 in-line. Revenue of $9.62B (+9% Y/Y). Raises FY'12 EPS guidance to $4.58-4.68. Shares +2.5% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:50 AM
  • STJ

    More on St. Jude's (STJ -1.1%) earnings: "Although sales in the U.S. were down 2% due primarily...

    More on St. Jude's (STJ -1.1%) earnings: "Although sales in the U.S. were down 2% due primarily to weakness in the U.S. cardiac rhythm management market, international sales increased 23% and now represent the majority of our business." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 AM
  • FFIV

    F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV) -2.4% ahead of its earnings report later today.
